question: Which of the following was the founder of the Servants of India Society?
explanation: The Servants of India Society was formed in Pune, Maharashtra, on June 12, 1905 by Gopal Krishna Gokhale. He left the Deccan Education Society to form this association. Prominent Indians were its members and leaders. It chose to remain away from political activities and organizations like the Indian National Congress. The Society organized many campaigns to promote education, sanitation, health care and fight the social evils of untouchability and discrimination, alcoholism, poverty, oppression of women and domestic abuse
